comment: Professor Eybelman is an absolutely incredible teacher. this course included four Essays, and a few discussion posts along with replying to other classmates. the course also had three projects, articles you read to do the projects along with discussions, and about forty or fifty grammar assignments. you get out what you put in!

If you have the chance to take Dr Eybelman, I would do so immediately.  I am a HS junior taking Eng 1101 as my 1st online DE class, and it was great.  There are weekly discussion questions (about a page each) and responses to 3 classmates.  There are 3 small "projects" involving reading and summarizing, and 4 papers. Do the work = A
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Very easy professor and gets class booked quickly. Discussion post every week 3 essays and occasionally a vocab game here and there that's it.

Hands down one of the greatest Professors I've had so far at KSU. Replies to emails/questions within a few hours. Very lenient on grading. Doesn't overload you with work, and his discussion posts take less than 30 minutes to complete. Posts content and due dates well in advance. Definitely an easy class.

Professor Eybelman is a great professor. There are only a few assignments each week, which are not too difficult. You should be able to finish each week's homework in less than an hour other than the research paper and proposal. He grades very leniently and will ensure students do well in his class.

I loved this teacher! I had him for an online class and there were two assignments a week. Not much reading, and the assignments were fairly easy. Very clear criteria and an easy grader. Make videos each week to let us know what we had to do, overall very organized.
What I appreciated the most about this Professor was the weekly videos discussing the weeks work. Clear and to the point. He was organized and fair.

If you need a gen ed requirement, take him. He was great with updating his page and was a lenient grader. 10 discussion posts on interesting topics, 3 projects on textbook chapters, and an 8-page research paper as the final (gives lots of time). Non-stress class and interesting.

Professor Eybelman works with you and helps you out in any way that he can and answers emails promptly. I took him online and still, he never left me to struggle. The coursework is easy and not a heavy load. I definitely recommend this professor.

The only slightly difficult thing was the 10 page paper due at the end but he gave plenty of time and resources. This is one of the most enjoyable classes I have ever taken online. I actually looked forward to the simple homework and the research for my paper because all of my other profs were so insanely difficult. He was awesome and chill.
Wonderful Professor, He grades very fair and lenient and provides everything you need to write the required papers. Not much homework, a discussion or assignment each week.

Gene Eybelman is a professor I'd love to have again. His class is very simple and was an easy A for me. I was able to learn a lot more about some wonderful world literature, and I also ended up buying one of the books we read a bit of in class. Thank you, Gene, for making your class so refreshing, easy, and interesting for me!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I definitely recommend this course. It was super easy and Professor Eybelman is really caring towards his students. The only bad thing is InQuizitive, which is just kinda tedious. Overall, take this course!
Easiest literature class known to man. However, there are a ton of papers and discussion posts but they're all super easy! He's an amazing teacher. 10/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: Super chill and easy to approach professor. Class is pretty straightforward as long as you do your work. Wish I could have the opportunity to take him again but all my English credits are now filled, unfortunately...
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Eybelman is amazing. His course is so easy to navigate. There is reading, 1-2 discussion posts with 3 responses to other students, video(s), and 1-2 quizzes for the majority of the weeks. he has 3 short essays 3-4 pages and a final essay 8-10 pages. the final essay can be done in a group. Overall he seemed to be a pretty chill guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor is really great, just let him know when something comes up and you are unable to do an assignment and he'll extend. Super chill grader. Discussion and quiz every week, three 4 page essays the whole semester, and one ten page essay as a final which you can work on as a group. Just do the work on time and you're fine.

Prof Eybelman seemed so sweet even though I only took him online. It was a lot of reading for weekly discussion posts but he was an extremely easy grader. Quizzes were not bad either. At the end we had a final paper and I ended up getting a 100 so definitely take him if you are looking for an easy going online class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Literally the best professor ever. I highly highly recommend him!! Easy grader. Lots of work but its easy . As long as you turn everything on time and finish you are good!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: This was the easiest class Ive had in college. As long as you meet the length requirements on essays youll get an A on them. Discussion post and quiz every week, theyre very easy. You must buy the textbooks to use for the discussions. Hes very kind, Id take him again.
Great prof! Quizzes, discussions, and Essays, but if all of your grammar and citations are correct, you'll get a 100.

I took this course online and it was a breeze. Read the textbook, write a short summary/feelings on it and interact with other students online. A couple of papers and the final was a group paper. Very easy grader, would recommend

Hands down best English professor!I believe it can be an easy "A" if you really put in the work. 3-4 readings per week and weekly discussions and reading quizzes; 4 short essays and a final paper (25%) that can be done as a group project. I took the class online. His class is very organized, he sends weekly reminders. Easy grader. Recommend!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Take this online class!! You have four short essays and one final paper just do it and format is correct you get 100. Dont buy the books for the class because all the stories are online you can use for the discussion post. Literally easy 100.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Eybelman is an AWESOME teacher! Read, participate in discussion board, and start final group project as early as possible. The work is not hard and he gives plenty of time for reading and writing. It is a bit of writing but really not that difficult to do. If you don't get an 'A' in this class that just means you didn't try.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Easy A. Very understanding and nice guy. Do your work and you'll make an A. A real gem!

I took this class online. There were 3 short papers, and every week there was a quiz, 3 short reading assignments, and a discussion question. This teacher seems nice. He did not offer make up work or extra credit.
Lots of reading and discussion posts but it wasn't miserable. Just make you sure you maybe 1.5 hours a week to get er done
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This was my first online class and Eybelman made it a great experience. Grades extremely leniently and very fast just do all the work and youll get an A. Theres weekly readings/discussion posts, quizzes on readings, 4 short essays, and a large final paper. Great professor, hes approachable, reasonable and genuinely cares about his students.

Professor Eybelman is an incredible teacher! He genuinely cares about his students and their successes. If you struggle to keep up with online course work, he accepts late work. Weekly readings, quizzes and discussions-- very easy. 4 short papers and a final 8pg group paper. No midterm or final exam. Best instructor to take this course with! :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: You write four essays and one final paper, which are graded very easily. The discussion posts are once a week in which you discuss the small stories you read. The quizzes over the readings can be worded weird sometimes, but are fairly easy. He is a very nice man and def recommend him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Such a fantastic teacher and class! Most of the discussions are simply for a participation grade. There are a few quizzes that aren't too difficult if you've read the books, and the essays are fairly easy as well. Prof Eybelman is very kind and always emails back in a timely manner. I would definitely recommend taking this class!

Class is very easy. Quizzes on readings which are easy to look up, discussions every week, four short essays, no midterm, and final exam essay which is done in a group. Class is easy, got 97.9% in the class and he is a super easy grader. Take him. You will not regret it! Easy A class!

This was the EASIEST class I've ever taken in my life. TAKE IT ONLINE! There are essays, discussions, and quizzes. Quizzes are hard but are a small portion of the grade. Just follow instructions and you'll make a 100 on everything else, even all of your essays. He gives very clear instructions so you can't mess up. Very helpful professor.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Favorite class! amazing professor! He is always making students laugh and cares about them and their grades. Very lenient on turning in late work with good excuse. He makes the class enjoyable for everyone. Success is his goal for all students. Required to write about 8 papers during the semester but, instructions are always clear. Would take again

He is a great professor for online. His instructions were always very clear and made sure that all of the necessary assignments were available ahead of time. His discussion boards are lengthy, but he usually only gives you 2-3 assignments/week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: He was seriously awesome, and this class was an easy A. It was like one discussion post and quiz a week, which took no time.
This professor is the bomb!He's amazing and will do anything he can to make you pass. Everything was easy in this class and the professor is so involved I LOVED this class!

It's not up for discussion just take the class. If it was up to me I'd take him for every class in the English department that's required. I signed up on this site just to give him a good review. Need I say more?

Great professor! Writing is not a strong suit of mine and he Professor Eybelman made it fun. There were 10 current events, 5 chapter summaries, one group project and 4 papers. Cancels class sometimes, always lets out early. He will work with you if you talk to him. Great professor, I will take again if I have the opportunity!

Great all around guy. He really wants to see his students progress and he is very laid back and nice. I wish I could take him again. He makes English class not stressful, but you still improve your writing abilities.

Best Professor I have had yet! He is very helpful. You have 4 papers (made all A's - he grades very easily) and current events each week. Most papers he does not set a page length/word count. Cancels class all the time. One research paper at the end and small group project. Very little effort and still have an A in the class. I would take again!!!

Mr. Eybelman is a awesome professor, he is so helpful and wants all of his student to succeed. If you are an adult learner I would definitely recommend him. He was very helpful to me after being out of school for so many years. I  would definitely take him again.

Most classes are short. Many will not be mandatory or will be cancelled.. Tough on the grading with the four essays, make sure someone proofreads and you should be fine. Essays about whatever topic. Only hard part would be the 6-10 research paper if you wait last minute. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE AT ALL n do all basic Assignments... EASY A!!!!
Really easy. Cancels class ALL THE TIME. The other times class gets out at least 20 minutes early. We only had one class where we stayed the whole time.

Okay, so he's really really easy. If that's the class you're looking for, take him! But it's almost rather insulting how basic his teaching is.  He teaches you how to "sound smart." Four 2-page essays over a topic from a list, 10 current events, 5 chapter summaries, a group project, and then a final research paper which you spend six weeks on.

TAKE HIS CLASS. DO IT. RIGHT NOW. Literally the easiest thing ever. He's such a nice guy, and he makes the class so simple and fun. He cancels class VERY often, and 23rds through the semester he told us we didn't have to come to class anymore, just submit things online. When we did have class, most of the time, it was like 30 minutes, tops.
He is super good ^_*

An amazing teacher!!! He works to help every student. Offers one on one feedback! Understands things come up in life, but do not abuse his generousity or kindness. He is very fair. I wish he offered every English I need. If you want to strive for an A, and want a teacher who is fun, has great stories, and engages with the his class. TAKE HIM!!!
Amazing teacher. Don't worry about not being good enough at writing. He takes you from how you are now and makes you so much better.

Excellent professor! Requirements for his class are clearly listed. I would take again. He helps his students, gives feedback for success, and wants to see all of his students make an A! Do the assignments, make an A, that simple! He will help you, by reviewing and giving feedback before due date, if you struggle with your writings!

I took this guy because he offered the class late. I had no idea how awesome he was! He grades fair and I made an 88 only because I didn't turn in the last paper. He has cute projects and nothing is difficult. HIGHLY RECOMMEND taking him. Haven't enjoyed class as much since him. Also pretty attractive guy- so that was nice.
Awesome teacher ever!

Kind and easy professor. Understands if you have to miss class, keeps you updated and very helpful. You will have four small essays in the first half of the semester, along with 10 current events and chapter outlines for the required text. In the second half of the semester you will work on your "big paper", which is not difficult.

By far one of the best English teachers I have ever had. He makes everything crystal clear, he is easy to understand, and he also has a great sense of humor. Papers are almost too easy and he is very understanding with anything. Take him and you won't regret the easy A.
He one of the best teacher that KSU ever had.

His class is enjoyable. He takes on a practical approach--the more you write, a better writer you will become. He does not nag or belittle students. I think he is a little too easy and does not challenge students. He is willing to stay late does a lot of one-on-one feedback. Great for ESL/Regents students.

Very helpful, teaches through practical experience.  He is not concerned with spelling.  Basicaly take notes, not mandatory due to his use of vista to email notes to you.  Pay attention and get an easy A.  A fun teacher

If I can make an A in this class, anyone can. Just make sure to turn everything in and you'll do great. He is very lenient about grading and turning this in by the due date. I took the class on Saturday adn we always got out early, however attendence is mandatory. He has the cutest little accent though!

Easy A! All you have to do is turn in the Reading/Responses (respond to any news article you choose), and turn in all the essays. I took this class on a Saturday. There were 9 essays and he does take attendance. He has a great sense of humor and you get out early every time. TAKE HIM FOR ENGLISH 1101! AMAZING :)

Great teacher, very friendly. Very easy to understand, and took the time to get to know all his students. I originally dreaded this class because of a lack of interest in the subject, but ended up with an A+ because I became very interested due to his teaching methods.

I almost dropped the class prior to attending because I thought it was too much to take on in addition to my other classes. However, by the first day, I was already having fun. By end of two weeks, this class was the best among my other courses, all due to the Professor. He is a great teacher, has clarity and ease, is serious yet compassionate.
